data.meta_description: 2024 Jul 10 - Queen Farida of Egypt, born Safinaz Zulficar in 1921, was the first wife of King Farouk I and served as the queen consort from 1938 to 1948. Known for her beauty and modern outlook, Queen Farida brought a sense of grace and charm to the Egyptian royal court during a time of significant political and social changes. Educated in France, Queen Farida embodied a blend of Western modernity and Egyptian tradition. Her marriage to King Farouk I in 1938 was initially celebrated as a union of youthful promise. During her time as queen consort, Farida engaged in various charitable activities, focusing on social welfare and education. She symbolized a new era for Egyptian queens, embracing a more public role and interacting with the people. Despite the initial optimism surrounding their marriage,
